Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk evolution-data-server
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: evolution-data-server bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The evolution-data-server packages provide a unified back-end for applications which interact with contacts, tasks and calendar information. Evolution Data Server was originally developed as a back-end for the Evolution information management application, but is now used by various other applications. This update fixes the following bugs: Because of erroneous code segments in Evolution Data Server, a failed IMAP message download generated a redundant error message and did not trigger another download of the IMAP message. This update fixes the erroneous code. Now, when an IMAP message fails to download, the Evolution client attempts to download the message again as intended. (BZ#1097250) Prior to this update, if the Evolution client disconnected unexpectedly from the IMAP server, a bug caused the Evolution client to display an error instead of attempting to reconnect automatically. This update implements a fix for the mentioned bug and Evolution now correctly attempts to reconnect to the IMAP server after a disconnect. (BZ#1097251) Due to errors in its underlying code, memory leaks could occur in Evolution Data Server. This update amends these errors and the memory leaks now no longer occur. (BZ#1097253) Prior to this update, the Evolution client unintentionally removed the cache of the IMAP subfolder when the "scanning for changed messages" process failed (for instance when the user cancelled this process). As a consequence, Evolution in some cases had to download summary information for all the messages in the mail folder, including the ones with information previously already downloaded, which was consuming excessive time and resources. With this update, a fix has been implemented for Evolution to handle scan interruptions properly. As a result, Evolution no longer removes the IMAP subfolder cache and thus does not have to download redundant message information. (BZ#1097252) Previously, a bug prevented Evolution Data Server from correctly processing shared mail folders on a Cyrus IMAP server. As a consequence, when it accessed a share message folder on a Cyrus IMAP server, Evolution could not display the messages the folder contained. This bug has been fixed and accessing shared mail folders on a Cyrus IMAP server with Evolution now functions as intended. (BZ#1100240) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: This update introduces the support for multiple connections during IMAP operations into the IMAPX library. Now, IMAPX is significantly more responsive during demanding IMAP operations, such as folder updates. (BZ#1097249) Users of evolution-data-server are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
